intro: Canthium didymum var. lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spurge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow flowers clustered in cyathia. The plant is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. It has a smooth, succulent stem and is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
